heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 03 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (206°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 2.3°C) and feels like temperature (down 1.5°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.4 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 296 m) and pressure (down 10 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 44.3°C), dew point temperature (up 41.5°C), outside temperature (up 43.9°C), and inside temperature (up 51.9°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 296.0m higher than yesterday, 158.6m higher than the past week, 27.1m higher than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 817m to 2540m and averaged 1734.0m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and calm and still conditions are expected. Showers, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and the light is absent. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
